common: There are no adequate and well-controlled studies in pregnant women to inform a drug associated risk; there are limited data with use of drug in pregnant women; advise pregnant women of potential risk to fetus and mother; treatment should only be administered during pregnancy if potential benefit justifies potential risk to fetus and mother

description: In embryofetal studies in rats and rabbits, oral administration of alcaftadine during period of organogenesis did not produce maternal or embryofetal toxicity at clinically relevant doses;

common: There is no information regarding presence of drug in human milk, effects on breastfed infants, or on milk production to inform risk to an infant during lactation; the developmental and health benefits of breastfeeding should be considered, along with the motherâ€™s clinical need for treatment, and any potential adverse effects on breastfed infant from therapy
